action.action-desc: Mr. Buyer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

Additional sponsors: Mr. Rogers of Kentucky, Mr. Cassidy, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, Mr. Stearns, Mr. Boozman, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Mr. Walz, Mr. Brown of South Carolina, Mr. Lamborn, Mr. Buchanan, Mr. Michaud, Mr. Miller of Florida, Ms. Corrine Brown of Florida, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Snyder, and Mr. Bright
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for an increase in the amount payable by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to veterans for improvements and structural alterations furnished as part of home health services.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Disabled Veterans Home Improvement and Structural Alteration Grant Increase Act of 2009.

section.header: Increase in amount available to disabled veterans for improvements and structural alterations furnished as part of home health services

subsection.text: Section 1717(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking $1,200 and inserting $2,000.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to a veteran who first applies for benefits under section 1717(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

A veteran who exhausts such veteran’s eligibility for benefits under section 1717(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, before the date of the enactment of this Act, is not entitled to additional benefits under such section by reason of the amendments made by subsection (a).

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
